h2901.definition: a primitive root; to spin; spin.

h2902.definition: a primitive root; to smear, especially with lime; daub, overlay, plaister, smut.

h2903.definition: from an unused root meaning to go around or bind; a fillet for the forehead; frontlet.

h2904.definition: a primitive root; to pitch over or reel; hence (transitively) to cast down or out; carry away, (utterly) cast (down, forth, out), send out.

h2905.definition: from an unused root meaning to range in a regular manner; a row; hence, a wall; row.

h2906.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6697}}; a rock or hill; mountain.

h2907.definition: a primitive root; to pounce as a bird of prey; haste.

h2908.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h2901}}; hunger (as twisting); fasting.

h2909.definition: a primitive root; to stretch a bow, as an archer; (bow-) shot.

h2910.definition: from {{h2909}} (or {{h2902}}) in the sense of overlaying; (in the plural only) the kidneys (as being covered); hence (figuratively) the inmost thought; inward parts.

h2911.definition: from {{h2912}}; a hand mill; hence, a millstone; to grind.

h2912.definition: a primitive root; to grind meal; hence, to be a concubine (that being their employment); grind(-er).

h2913.definition: from {{h2912}}; a hand mill; hence (figuratively) chewing; grinding.

h2914.definition: from an unused root meaning to burn; a boil or ulcer (from the inflammation), especially a tumor in the anus or pudenda (the piles); emerod.

h2915.definition: from (the equiv. of) {{h2902}}; mortar or plaster; daubing.

h2916.definition: from an unused root meaning apparently to be sticky (rather perhaps a demonstrative); from {{h2894}}, through the idea of dirt to be swept away); mud or clay; figuratively, calamity; clay, dirt, mire.

h2917.definition: (Aramaic) perhaps, by interchange, for a word corresponding to {{h2916}}; clay; miry.

h2918.definition: feminine of (an equivalent to) {{h2905}}; a wall; hence, a fortress or a hamlet; (goodly) castle, habitation, palace, row.

h2921.definition: a primitive root; properly, to cover with pieces; i.e. (by implication) to spot or variegate (as tapestry); clouted, with divers colours, spotted.

h2922.definition: apparently from {{h2921}} in the (orig.) sense of covering (for protection); (compare {{h2924}}); a lamb; lamb.

h2923.definition: from the plural of {{h2922}}; lambs; Telaim, a place in Palestine; Telaim.

h2924.definition: by variation for {{h2922}}; a lamb; lamb.

h2926.definition: a primitive root; properly, to strew over, i.e. (by implication) to cover in or plate (with beams); cover.

h2927.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2926}}; to cover with shade; have a shadow.

h2928.definition: from an unused root meaning to break up or treat violently; oppression; Telem, the name of a place in Idumaea, also of a temple doorkeeper; Telem.

h2929.definition: from the same as {{h2728}}; oppressive; Talmon, a temple doorkeeper; Talmon.

h2930.definition: a primitive root; to be foul, especially in a ceremial or moral sense (contaminated); defile (self), pollute (self), be (make, make self, pronounce) unclean, × utterly.

h2931.definition: from {{h2930}}; foul in a religious sense; defiled,   infamous, polluted(-tion), unclean.

h2933.definition: a collateral form of {{h2930}}; to be impure in a religious sense; be defiled, be reputed vile.

h2934.definition: a primitive root; to hide (by covering over); hide, lay privily, in secret.

h2935.definition: from an unused root probably meaning to weave; a basket (of interlaced osiers); basket.

h2936.definition: a primitive root; to soil; defile.

h2937.definition: a primitive root; to wander; causatively to lead astray; seduce.

h2938.definition: a primitive root; to taste; figuratively, to perceive; × but, perceive, taste.

h2939.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2938}}; to taste; causatively to feed; make to eat, feed.

h2940.definition: from {{h2938}}; properly, a taste, i.e. (figuratively) perception; by implication, intelligence; transitively, a mandate; advice, behaviour, decree, discretion, judgment, reason, taste, understanding.

h2941.definition: (Aramaic) from {{h2939}}; compare {{h2940}}); properly, a taste, i.e.	a judicial sentence; account, × to be commanded, commandment, matter.

h2942.definition: (Aramaic) from {{h2939}}, and equivalent to {{h2941}}; properly, flavor; figuratively, judgment (both subjective and objective); hence, account (both subjectively and objectively); chancellor,   command, commandment, decree,   regard, taste, wisdom.

h2943.definition: a primitive root; to load a beast; lade.

h2944.definition: a primitive root; to stab; thrust through.

h2945.definition: from {{h2952}} (perhaps referring to the tripping gait of children); a family (mostly used collectively in the singular); (little) children (ones), families.

h2946.definition: a primitive root; or perhaps a denominative from {{h2947}}, from dandling on the palms; to flatten out or extend (as a tent); figuratively, to nurse a child (as promotive of growth); span, swaddle.

h2947.definition: from {{h2946}}; a spread of the hand, i.e. a palm-breadth (not 'span' of the fingers); architecturally, a corbel (as a supporting palm); coping, hand-breadth.

h2950.definition: a primitive root; properly, to stick on as a patch; figuratively, to impute falsely; forge(-r), sew up.

h2951.definition: of foreign derivation; a military governor; captain.

h2952.definition: a primitive root; apparently; to trip (with short steps) coquettishly; mince.

h2953.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h6852}}, and meaning the same as {{h6856}}; a finger-nail; also a hoof or claw; nail.

h2954.definition: a primitive root; properly, apparently to be thick; figuratively, to be stupid; be fat.

h2955.definition: probably from {{h5197}}; a dropping (of ointment); Taphath, an Israelitess; Taphath.

h2956.definition: a primitive root; to drive on; figuratively, to follow close; continual.

h2958.definition: a variation of {{h2962}}; not yet; before.

h2959.definition: a primitive root; to overburden; weary.

h2961.definition: from an unused root apparently meaning to be moist; properly, dripping; hence, fresh (i.e. recently made such); new, putrefying.

h2962.definition: from an unused root apparently meaning to interrupt or suspend; properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before; before, ere, not yet.

h2963.definition: a primitive root; to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels); catch, × without doubt, feed, ravin, rend in pieces, × surely, tear (in pieces).

h2964.definition: from {{h2963}}; something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food; leaf, meat, prey, spoil.

h2965.definition: from {{h2963}}; recently torn off, i.e. fresh; pluckt off.

h2966.definition: feminine (collectively) of {{h2964}}; prey, i.e. flocks devoured by animals; ravin, (that which was) torn (of beasts, in pieces).

h2967.definition: (Aramaic) from a name of foreign derivation; a Tarpelite (collectively) or inhabitants of Tarpel, a place in Assyria; Tarpelites. y

h2968.definition: a primitive root; to desire; long.

h2969.definition: a primitive root; to be suitable; appertain.

h2970.definition: or יַאֲזַנְיָהוּ; from {{h238}} and {{h3050}}; heard of Jah; Jaazanjah, the name of four Israelites; Jaazaniah. Compare {{h3153}}.

h2971.definition: from {{h215}}; enlightener; Jair, the name of four Israelites; Jair.

h2972.definition: patronymically from {{h2971}}; a Jairite or descendant of Jair; Jairite.

h2973.definition: a primitive root; properly, to be slack, i.e. (figuratively) to be foolish; dote, be (become, do) foolish(-ly).

h2974.definition: a primitive root (probably rather the same as {{h2973}} through the idea of mental weakness); properly, to yield, especially assent; hence (pos.) to undertake as an act of volition; assay, begin, be content, please, take upon, × willingly, would.

h2975.definition: of Egyptian origin; a channel, e.g. a fosse, canal, shaft; specifically the Nile, as the one river of Egypt, including its collateral trenches; also the Tigris, as the main river of Assyria; brook, flood, river, stream.

h2976.definition: a primitive root; to desist, i.e. (figuratively) to despond; (cause to) despair, one that is desperate, be no hope.

h2977.definition: or יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ; from the same root as {{h803}} and {{h3050}}; founded of Jah; Joshijah, the name of two Israelites; Josiah.

h2979.definition: from the same as {{h871}}; stepping; Jeatherai, an Israelite; Jeaterai.

h2980.definition: a primitive root; to bawl; cry out.

h2981.definition: from {{h2986}}; produce, i.e. a crop or (figuratively) wealth; fruit, increase.

h2982.definition: from {{h947}}; trodden, i.e. threshing-place; Jebus, the original name of Jerusalem; Jebus.

h2983.definition: patrial from {{h2982}}; a Jebusite or inhabitant of Jebus; Jebusite(-s).

h2984.definition: from {{h977}}; choice; Jibchar, an Israelite; Ibhar.

h2985.definition: from {{h995}}; intelligent; Jabin, the name of two Canaanitish kings; Jabin.

h2986.definition: a primitive root; properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp); bring (forth), carry, lead (forth).

h2987.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2986}}; to bring; bring, carry.

h2989.definition: the same as {{h2988}}; Jabal, an antediluvian; Jabal.

h2991.definition: from {{h1104}} and {{h5971}}; devouring people; Jibleam, a place in Palestine; Ibleam.

h2992.definition: a primitive root of doubtful meaning; used only as a denominative from {{h2993}}; to marry a (deceased) brother's widow; perform the duty of a husband's brother, marry.

h2993.definition: from (the orig. of) {{h2992}}; a brother-in-law; husband's brother.

h2994.definition: feminine participle of {{h2992}}; a sister-in-law; brother's wife, sister in law.

h2995.definition: from {{h1129}} and {{h410}}; built of God; Jabneel, the name of two places in Palestine; Jabneel.

h2996.definition: from {{h1129}}; a building; Jabneh, a place in Palestine; Jabneh.

h2997.definition: from {{h1129}} and {{h3050}}; built of Jah; Jibnejah, an Israelite; Ibneiah.

h2998.definition: from {{h1129}} and {{h3050}}; building of Jah; Jibnijah, an Israelite; Ibnijah.

h2999.definition: probably from {{h1238}}; pouring forth; Jabbok, a river east of the Jordan; Jabbok.

h3000.definition: from {{h1288}} and {{h3050}}; blessed of Jah; Jeberekjah, an Israelite; Jeberechiah.
